info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 3:21PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
At 320 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Snowy Range Pass to Rob Roy Reservoir to Lake Owen Campground to Woods Landing-Jelm to 7 miles southeast of Boswell Creek Campground. Movement was northeast at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Albany, Nine Mile, Brooklyn Lake, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Sugar Loaf Campground, Woods Landing-Jelm, Libby Creek Campground, Harmony, McFadden, Twin Buttes Lake, Deep Creek Campground, Sheep Mountain, Centennial, Nash Fork Campground, Snowy Range Pass, Lake Owen Campground, Lake Hattie Reservoir, Wild Horse Ranch, Rob Roy Reservoir, and Medicine Bow Peak.
This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 274 and 305.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL CARBON AND SOUTHWESTERN ALBANY COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM MDT

area.areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range; Laramie Valley
